Class MeetingSever

  • java.lang.Object
    • MeetingSever
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MeetingSever
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Usage: Java MeetingSever 'port number' 'thread pool size' A meeting server exists to serve client requests from a meeting client. These requests take the form of a course at MUN, to which the server returns the meeting times for each section. Whenever a client connects to this server, its request is handled by a RequestHandler from the thread pool. The RequestHandler then returns meeting times for each section and exits the connection.
    Author:
    mokane3562

    • Constructor Detail

      • MeetingSever

        public MeetingSever(int port,
            int poolSize)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new Meeting Sever(sic). The server runs until terminated by ^C.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated
        poolSize - the number of threads in the pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket
